dublin_core.dcvalue: Panel Cost Effectiveness This session will feature panelists who will explore the question of where there has been good return on investment on mobile health applications for frontline workers The session will also explore the cost effectiveness of mobile solutions compared with traditional paper based options A hard look at the evidence will be explored as well as lessons learned from the the MAMA South Africa Join this session as some of the most pressing questions about digital health value for money are explored by Dimagi Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health and GSMA Presented by Neal Lesh Chief Strategy Officer Dimagi
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-22T11:16:09Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 most_impact_least_effort_gdhf.pptx: 343476 bytes, checksum: 4ed6ed37b148181989f99f0b3b49cad1 (MD5)
How can we help generate the most impact for the least effort?
